rules: Rule1: Provided that the studio hires the actor, then the actor is under contract.
Rule2: Whenever the studio hires the actor, the actor is on schedule.
Rule3: The studio hires the actor, or the show uses a celebrity guest.
Rule4: If the network extends the contract for the show, then the network increases the budget.
Rule5: Should the network increase the budget, then the network renews the show.
Rule6: Provided that the actor has an exclusive clause, it is not the case that the actor is under contract.
Rule7: If the agent negotiates the contract, then it is not the case that the agent signs the contract.
Rule8: Provided that the investor has funding, then if the agent negotiates the contract, the agent signs the contract.
Rule9: Under the condition that the investor invests in the facility, the investor approves the budget.
Rule10: If the equipment has a technical issue, then provided that the studio has a backup plan, the actor is not on schedule.
Rule11: Provided that the facility has a safety violation, then if the studio has a backup plan, the actor is not on schedule.
Rule12: If the studio passes inspection, then either the equipment has a technical issue or the facility has a safety violation.
Rule13: Under the condition that the studio fails inspection, then either the equipment has a technical issue or the facility has a safety violation.
Rule14: The production meets the deadline, or if it is not the case that the studio passes inspection or fails inspection, then the studio receives a fine.
Rule15: If the studio experiences a power outage, then provided that the studio has a backup plan, the actor is not on schedule.
Rule16: Either the studio experiences a power outage, or the technology has a network failure.
Rule17: Should the technology have a network failure, then the production loses data.
Rule18: Provided that the actor has a replacement, then it is not the case that the actor is on schedule.
Rule19: The actor has a replacement, or the studio has a backup plan.

Rule20: The studio receives an insurance payout, or if it is not the case that (provided that the studio declares force majeure, then if the production loses data, provided that the studio has a backup plan, the actor is not on schedule), then it is not the case that the studio suspends production.
Rule21: If the studio seeks arbitration, then either the studio files a lawsuit or it is not the case that the studio receives an insurance payout.
Rule22: Provided that the production implements CGI, then the production uses a virtual set.
Rule23: If the production uses a virtual set, then the production employs motion capture.
Rule24: If the show has a sponsor, then the show is profitable.
Rule25: Provided that it is not the case that the studio passes inspection or fails inspection, then it is not the case that the studio receives a fine.
Rule26: If it is not the case that (provided that the director has creative differences, then it is not the case that the production meets the deadline), then the director is replaced.

Rule27: Provided that it is not the case that (if the studio declares force majeure, then if the production loses data, provided that the studio has a backup plan, the actor is not on schedule), then the studio suspends production.
Rule28: Provided that it is not the case that (the production uses an AI script or, if the studio has a backup plan, the actor is not on schedule), then the production implements CGI.
Rule29: Under the condition that it is not the case that (the production uses an AI script or, if the studio has a backup plan, the actor is not on schedule), the show has a sponsor.
Rule30: Should it not be the case that (the production uses an AI script or, if the studio has a backup plan, the actor is not on schedule), then it is not the case that the show is profitable.

Rule31: If it is not the case that (provided that the executive greenlights the project, then if it is not the case that (the production uses an AI script or, if the studio has a backup plan, the actor is not on schedule), the show is profitable), then the network extends the contract for the show.

Rule32: Under the condition that it is not the case that (provided that the executive greenlights the project, then if it is not the case that (the production uses an AI script or, if the studio has a backup plan, the actor is not on schedule), the show is profitable), then it is not the case that the network renews the show.

Rule33: If it is not the case that (provided that it is not the case that (if the production employs motion capture, then the show is profitable), then the show wins an award), then the show gets syndication.
Rule34: Provided that it is not the case that (if it is not the case that the investor has funding, then the investor invests in the facility), then the facility upgrades the equipment.

Rule35: Under the condition that it is not the case that (if it is not the case that the investor has funding, then the investor invests in the facility), then it is not the case that the facility upgrades the equipment.
Rule36: If it is not the case that the actor has an exclusive clause, then the agent negotiates the contract.
Rule37: Should it not be the case that the investor has funding, then it is not the case that the investor approves the budget.
facts: Fact1: The director has creative differences.
Fact2: The studio declares force majeure.
Fact4: The executive greenlights the project.
Fact5: The director is not replaced.
Fact6: The studio does not file a lawsuit.
Fact7: The show does not win an award.
Fact8: The show does not get syndication.
Fact9: The production does not use an AI script.

question: The show uses a celebrity guest.
